pullRequest.body:
This PR adds the analytic continuation and functional equation for the odd part of the Hurwitz zeta function.

---

nodes.body: maintainer merge

Thank!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9069730454/job/24919954454)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9069730454/job/24919954105)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9069730454/job/24919955307)
LGTM!
LGTM!
Copy&paste? I think `hurwitzZetaOdd` and `sinZeta` should be swapped here.

```suggestion
  simp_rw [div_add' _ _ _ two_pi_I_ne_zero, â† mul_div_assoc]
```

```suggestion
  rw [mul_left_comm _ (cexp _),, â† mul_add,
```

```suggestion
  have aux1 : (-2 * Ï€ : â„‚) / (2 * Ï€ * I) = I := by
    rw [div_eq_iff two_pi_I_ne_zero, mul_comm I, mul_assoc _ I I, I_mul_I, neg_mul, mul_neg,
      mul_one]
```
I think the proof should start on the same line only if it finishes on that line.

```suggestion
  rw [jacobiThetaâ‚‚'_functional_equation, â† mul_one_div _ Ï„, mul_right_comm _ (cexp _),
    (by rw [cpow_one, â† div_div, div_self (neg_ne_zero.mpr I_ne_zero)] :
```

```suggestion
  simp_rw [map_mul, conj_I, conj_ofReal, map_neg, map_ofNat, neg_mul, neg_neg, half_add_self]
```

Since this occurs a number of times, it may make sense to add a
```lean
lemma Complex.im_I_mul_ofReal (x : â„) : (I * x).im = x := ...
```
(and the obvious variants) in, e.g., `Mathlib.Data.Complex.Basic` and then use it in this file.
Good point, this already occurs 13 times in the `hurwitzZeta` code, I will add it

```suggestion
  Â· fun_prop
  Â· have hx' : 0 < im (I * x) := by rwa [I_mul_im, ofReal_re]
    have hf : Continuous fun u : â„ â†¦ (a * I * u, I * u) := by fun_prop
```
`fun_prop` is actually faster here!

It might even be possible to mark the continuity statements for Jacobi theta functions so that `fun_prop` can use them; then most of the proff could just be `fun_prop`.

```suggestion
  fun_prop
```

```suggestion
    â† div_eq_inv_mul, eq_div_iff h3, mul_comm J _, mul_right_comm]
```

```suggestion
    mul_left_comm, jacobiThetaâ‚‚_term, â† Complex.exp_add]
```

Similar simplifications should be possible here. See [mul_left_comm](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Group/Basic.html#mul_left_comm), [mul_right_comm](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Group/Basic.html#mul_right_comm), [mul_mul_mul_comm](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Group/Basic.html#mul_mul_mul_comm) and other lemmas nearby.
Did you use the `says` combinator here on purpose? Just asking, because it is the only place where you do that.
I meant to take it out after doing a speed-test.

```suggestion
    norm_tsum_le_tsum_norm (hasSum_int_oddKernel b ht).summable.norm
```
`induction' a using QuotientAddGroup.induction_on with b` (like elsewhere) would also work (and is slightly faster). Is there some reason to not be consistent?
"an FE-pair"? Does "a"/"an" depend on the pronunciation or on the spelling?

```suggestion
  hfâ‚€ := rfl
  gâ‚€ := 0
  hgâ‚€ := rfl
```

```suggestion
    rw [div_mul_eq_mul_div, div_mul_eq_mul_div, mul_right_comm (-I)]
```

```suggestion
  rw [this]
  ring
```
(actually slightly faster)
This should be much simpler. It looks like API for `sign` is missing...

```lean
  have : (Int.sign n : â„‚) = SignType.sign (n : â„) := by
    simp only [Int.sign_eq_sign, sign_apply]
    norm_cast
    split_ifs
    Â· simp only [SignType.coe_one, Int.cast_one]
    Â· simp only [SignType.coe_neg_one, Int.cast_neg, Int.reduceNeg, Int.cast_one]
    Â· simp only [SignType.coe_zero, Int.cast_zero]
```
looks more principled (and is faster, though still slower than I think it should be).

At a cost of 600 hb, one can shorten the end game to
```lean
    split_ifs <;> simp
```
See [here on Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/SignType.20API/near/438180722).

I'm not convinced by these lemmas, given that:
* `simp` can prove them
* they're a trivial consequence of `mul_I_im` and `im_ofReal`, and `rw [mul_I_im, im_ofReal]` is only four characters longer than `rw [ofReal_mul_I_im]`


I'll let another reviewer decide if they're harmless enough to go in anyway.
`I_mul_ofReal_im` allows some simplification throughout `HurwitzZetaOdd`, so I think adding the lemmas makes sense. (But then I suggested them in the first place...)
On reflection I agree with Eric's view here. When I added in these lemmas, I realised they don't actually shorten the code at the point of use as much as I had expected.
